title.narrative: BEHAVIORAL CHANGE

description.narrative: More parents and caregivers have improved behaviour towards maternal, child and adolescent nutrition and feeding practices., which contributes to Evaluation, Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Immunization Services As Part Of Primary Health Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being, Nutrition In Early Childhood, Nutrition Of Adolescents And Women. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2025, child and adolescent malnutrition in all its forms is reduced, with a special focus on overweight and obesity.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: More parents and caregivers have improved behaviour towards maternal, child and adolescent nutrition and feeding practices.

description.narrative: UNICE Mexico’s advocacy and technical support resulted in the inclusion of a social and behavior change communication (SBCC) programme in the National Strategy on Healthy, Fair and Sustainable Diets. The mHealth programme was positioned as part of Ministry of Health’s services in two states and reached 1,178 caregivers of young children, contributing to improve theirpracticesrelated to breastfeeding, children’s diets, and physical activities. 6,623,821 children and adolescents were benefited through the teachings ofVida Saludable,the new primary and secondary school curriculum, which received technical support from UNICEF. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:26/01/2022
